result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV:

Cases 15CF384, 15CF388,15CM450,15CM480,15CM482,15CT532,15CT540,15CT556 called together at 11:17am [mo]
Defendant Joshua A Mitchell in court, in custody with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; 
pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Case 15CM482, Counts #1 and #2
--Mr. Mitchell questions the repeater enhancer; Clerk provides a copy of the JOC in case 11CF163 to Defense Counsel; the Court finds Mr. Mitchell to be a repeater based on these Court records.

plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Case 15CM450, Count #1
plea of " GUILTY  " entered on Case 15CM450, Count #2
plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Case 15CM480, Counts #1 and #2
plea of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Case 15CT556, Count #1
plea of " GUILTY  " entered on Case 15CF384, Counts #1 and #2


factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Mitchell   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court Reads In and Dismisses all remaining counts and cases.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Lippert submits letter from Deputy Bowman and Certificate of Completion

Statement made by Mr. Mitchell
Questioning by the Court of Mr. Mitchell

On Case 15CF384, Count #1
The Court sentences Mr. Mitchell   to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

On Case 15CF384, Count #2
The Court sentences Mr. Mitchell   to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1 in Case 15CF384


The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  228   days credit for time already served, to be applied to case 15CF384.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--mental health evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations, including taking medications
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
 per agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no alcohol 
--no controlled substances without valid prescription
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--random drug and alcohol screening
--no presence on the premises of any bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs
--to pay costs of cases 15CM450, 15CM480, 15CM482 and 15CT556 

On Case 15CM450, Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 90 days in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384; costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384

On Case 15CM450, Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 30 days in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384;costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384

On Case 15CM480, Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 30 days in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384;costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384
On Case 15CM480, Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 90 days in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384;costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384

On Case 15CM482, Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 6 months in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384;costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384
On Case 15CM482, Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 4 months in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384;costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384

On Case 15CT556,  the Court sentences Mr. Mitchell to 30 days in the jail, concurrent to sentence in 15CF384; the Court does not suspend Mr. Mitchell's driving privileges;costs to be paid as condition of Extended Supervision in Case 15CF384

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess:12:10pm

Cases 15CF384, 15CF388, 15CM450, 15CM480, 15CM482, 15CT532, 15CT540, and 15CT556 called together at 11:07am
Defendant Joshua A Mitchell in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews letter submitted by Mr. Mitchell requesting new counsel be appointed

Atty. Hagemann requests that Atty. De La Rosa be allowed to withdraw as counsel and that SPD appoint successor counsel for Mr. Mitchell
--Mr. Mitchell approves of this process

The Court allows Atty. De La Rosa to withdraw as counsel; the SPD office is to appoint successor counsel

The Court suspends any deadlines to allow Mr. Mitchell to be appointed new counsel.

recess: 11:10am

Defendant Joshua A Mitchell in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Status conference at 01-29-2016 08:30 am
Scheduling Notice

Case 15CF384 called at 10:18am 
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Joshua A Mitchell appears via videoconferencing from JCJ, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case 15CF384(Waiver of Preliminary Hearing scheduled):
Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Mitchell indicates he no longer wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing and wishes to have a Preliminary Hearing.
--the Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Cases 15CF388, 15CM450, 15CM480,15CM482, 15CT532,15CT540, and 15CT556 called together at 10:24am
All appearances remain the same

As to Cases 15CF388 and 15CM450:
--Atty. De La Rosa indicates that there may be a global resolution; requests an additional status
--no objection from ADA Hall



As to Cases 15CM480, 15CM482,15CT532,15CT540, and 15CT556(Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of all Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

As to Case 15CM480: 
The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

As to Case 15CM482:
The Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at 218 Water St., in Watertown
--no contact with Phillip Runge or his family

As to Cases 15CT532, 15CT540, and 15CT556:
The Court requires a $500 signature bond in EACH case, with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

recess: 10:33am

Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CF388 and 15CM450 called at 1:36pm [mo]
Defendant Joshua A Mitchell appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Attorney  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that Mr. Mitchell is eligible for SPD representation
The Court verifies the Defendant's name, date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
recess: 1:38pm--reconvene: 
As to Case 15CM450: Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
As to Case 15CF388: Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $150 CASH bond to cover both case 15CF388 and case 15CM450, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take all medications as prescribed
--not to discuss the facts of the case with Marsha Grimminga
--Not to Drive a Motor Vehicle
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**


recess 1:49 pm.
